visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart with the title 'Chart initial rendering time (lower is better)'. The chart should have two series: 'Data Grouping disabled' and 'Data Grouping enabled', each with specific data points. The x-axis should represent 'Sample size' with categories and formatted labels, and the y-axis should represent 'Time (s)' with formatted labels. The chart should have custom colors, zooming capabilities, and accessibility features. Additionally, the chart should have a subtitle indicating the device it was run on.

title.text: Chart initial rendering time (lower is better)

subtitle.text: Run on MacBook Pro M1 2021 16GM RAM

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart with specific customizations. The chart title is set to 'Chart initial rendering time (lower is better)', and a subtitle indicates the device specifications. The chart includes two data series: 'Data Grouping disabled' and 'Data Grouping enabled', each with their respective data points. The x-axis represents 'Sample size' with categories ranging from 10 to 100,000, and the labels are formatted to display values in thousands. The y-axis represents 'Time (s)' with labels formatted to display values in seconds and a minimum value of 0. The chart uses custom colors for the series and includes zooming capabilities for both x and y axes. Accessibility features are also enabled, providing descriptions for each data point. The tooltip is shared and formatted to display the loading time for each category of points.
